title: oc6 beta2 - spftp.php warnings are shown when executing the cron.php script.
body:
## expected behaviour

when the cron.php script is executed no warnings or errors should be displayed.

## actual behaviour

when the cron.php script is executed the following warnings are displayed:
````
warning: fopen(): filename cannot be empty in /var/www/htdocs/owncloud/apps/files_external/lib/sftp.php on line 97

warning: fwrite() expects parameter 1 to be resource, boolean given in /var/www/htdocs/owncloud/apps/files_external/lib/sftp.php on line 99

warning: fclose() expects parameter 1 to be resource, boolean given in /var/www/htdocs/owncloud/apps/files_external/lib/sftp.php on line 101
````
the configured sftp external storage can be accessed without problems therefore all required information should have been entered correctly.

## steps to reproduce

1) setup a sftp external storage in the admin settings
2) execute the cron.php script from the command line:

## environment

#### server configuration

os: linux 2.6.24-24
web server: apache2 2.4.6
database: mysql 5.1.72
php version: 5.4.21
owncloud version: 6.0 beta2

#### client configuration

browser: firefox 25.0
operating system: windows 7
